title: Machine Learning based – System for Prediciting Mastitis in Dairy Cows
abstract: In this work, a comparative study on high-efficiency machine learning algorithms for the goal of incorporating machine learning and Veterinary Medicine has been conducted. In this study, six machine learning algorithms have been used to predict Mastitis in dairy cattle. The study has applied SVM, RandomTree, RandomForest, J4S, j4Sgraft, CSForest classification algorithms on a benchmark dataset of Mastitis on dairy cattle. To evaluate the performance of the algorithms, the study has relied on the four measures: Accuracy, True Positive Rate or detection rate, False Positive Diagnosis Rate (FPR) or False Alarm Rate (FAR) and F-measure. For the dairy cattle Mastitis detection data set, all the decision trees outperformed the SVM algorithm by scoring the perfect score (100%) based on the Accuracy, F-measure and Detection Rate and 0% in FAR scales. After applying the SMOTE technique, the performance of SVM has been improved in terms of accuracy from 85% to 94% and the FAR has been decreased from 70% to 5%. Moreover, the SVM performance has been improved in this study to the perfect score in all metrics by using the normalization technique.
